body_raw: I limit myself in following considerations to the field $\mathbb Q_p$. As everybody interested in ultrametric calculus knows, the $p$-adic exponential function defined by series $$\exp_p(x) = \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{x^k}{k!}$$ converges only on a small ball $\mathcal B$ around $0$ equal to $p\mathbb Z_p$ (for $p \ge 3$) or $4 \mathbb Z_2$ (otherwise). Inspired by my previous post ,, About $\lim \left(1+\frac {x}{n}\right)^n$ '' I have decided to check whether this alternative representation is also true here, in $p$-adic context.
